relation: Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
There are safety escorts that run from 6pm-6am every day. But campus is light at all times and I've never felt unsafe.
There are hundreds of years of traditions and history on campus. Some of my favorite include lake Laverne, the zodiac, and VEISHEA
Besides hanging with friends; There is always a university run event being held on the weekends, mostly located in the MU
Great food, with many locations, but not much variety at the on campus restaurants.
There are so many options for places to live both on campus and off (if you are a transfer or upper class men looking for an apartment or house.
Depending on your major and what classes you take, it can be a lot of work. Especially when in either a design, engineering, or science program.

Understand that if you dont know what you want to do as freshman (either clubs, major, social, etc) that its OK! There is always enough activities/ time/ and events going on when on campus and off campus.
I love ISU! Besides the amazing campus that is beautiful during every extream Iowa season, the faculty is great. Every fall semester I return to Ames, it feels as if Im going home, not leaving.
pageTitle: Iowa State University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {385777=iowa state university is the perfect fit for anyone who wants to be successful in the future with their intended career. i believe that iowa state will help me prepare and get ready for life after college. i am excited to start my adventure at iowa state university in the fall of 2012., 534446=The campanile is the center piece of the school which is a clock tower that stands 72 feet tall on central campus and can be seen from anywhere. Also, there is V.E.I.S.H.E.A which is the largest student run celebration which is hosted in April every year including: music, parades, entertainment, student faculty tournaments and much more!, 261008=veishea, a week long celebration of the founding of iowa state university. starts in mid april. each day there are different events planned, and on saturday there is a parade, concerts, local food and much more. it is basically a mini state fair. campaniling, where you and your partner kiss under the campanile (big clock tower on campus) when the clock hits midnight., 845921=From dorms in Richardson court to the out of campus Maricopa being constructed for the fall of 2013 due to the high rates of returning students and incoming freshmans., 753386=If you are looking for a great college ministry check out The Salt Company. textAfterTable: Great for these types of students Prospective engineers, design majors, those pursuing computer-related fields, Iowa residents, and those looking for big opportunities. Tips for prospective students The campus is gorgeous, and feels more like a state park than a college. Definitely go to a football game if you get a chance, but stay away from Welch Avenue afterward. Jimmy John's, Jeff's Pizza, and The Fighting Burrito are located a few feet from campus, have delicious food, good prices, make deliveries, and are all open until around 3 AM. Take your parents to Hickory Park when they visit, you'll be glad you did. First year roommate assignments are usually random, so be prepared. Cyride, the bus system, makes it easy to get anywhere in Ames. The guy to girl ratio is unfavorable for men, but every female in that count is hot enough to be a model. Girls, you'll find every type of man you could imagine, and then some. Take the time to meet some of the international students. There are a lot of them, and you can learn a lot from them. The career fairs are huge and bring big opportunities. Always be in attendance. Bang for the buck Tuition is a hefty load on out-of-staters, and if you're an engineering major, your tuition goes up after two years. There
